intro: Diplycosia mekonggaensis, commonly known as the Mekonggaensis diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Mekong River basin. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are often woody. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
